intro: Monadenium nudicaule, commonly known as the naked-stemmed monadenium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually hairy and have a distinctive, narrow shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, often with yellow or greenish petals. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
